pullRequest.title: Hive: Make HiveCatalog based tables automatically readable from Hive
pullRequest.bodyText:
Added the needed extra fields on table creation.
Updated the TestHiveIcebergStorageHandlerWithHiveCatalog tests so they do not make the same modifications by themselves.

After the changes the tests are still able to queries, so we should be happy

commit.message: Hive: Make HiveCatalog based tables automatically readable from Hive
Added a table configuration to enable/disable hive access
Added the possibility to use hive-site.xml for configuring the hive engine related properties

nodes.bodyText: I think this should be in the storageDescriptor method instead of here in the commit.
Could we move this to a class for Hadoop configuration properties, like org.apache.iceberg.hadoop.ConfigProperties?

It looks like a lot of test cases are mixed together in this method, but separated by comments. I think it would be better to make these separate test methods because then they are run independently, so you can see all of the failures at once, instead of just one failure per run that potentially hides the others.

commit.message:
Addressed review comments:
- New ConfigProperties class
- Split up test cases
- Moved SD config changes
Unset the conf value (IntelliJ does not need this, but command line somehow sets the value to true)

nodes.bodyText: Should this be removed if the engine is not enabled? Because this is a table property, I don't think it would be automatically removed at any point.
